entry.title: Hummus! 1 x 700g jar of chickpeas (or 2 tins) Half of the aquafaba/ chickpea water (more or less, depending on how soft the chickpeas are) 3 tbsp runny tahini Juice of ½ - 1 lemon ½ tsp flaky sea salt 1 tbsp olive oil My tips for the smoothest hummu
entry.content: Hummus! 1 x 700g jar of chickpeas (or 2 tins) Half of the aquafaba/ chickpea water (more or less, depending on how soft the chickpeas are) 3 tbsp runny tahini Juice of ½ - 1 lemon ½ tsp flaky sea salt 1 tbsp olive oil My tips for the smoothest hummu

entry.title: Freekeh is my favourite grain and I would love to see more people eating it! - It’s really high in protein and fibre. One small serving (half cup) of cooked freekeh has about 8 grams of protein. - It also contains zinc, iron, copper, potassium, calcium,

entry.title: If you’re looking for a creamy, cosy bowl of goodness that you can make in 10 minutes - you’ve just found one. A dollop of vegan cream cheese mixed with the cherry tomato juice and the butterbean aquafaba magincally turns into a delicious velvety broth.
entry.content: If you’re looking for a creamy, cosy bowl of goodness that you can make in 10 minutes - you’ve just found one. A dollop of vegan cream cheese mixed with the cherry tomato juice and the butterbean aquafaba magincally turns into a delicious velvety broth.
